DataElement.preferredName: Uterine Adenosarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the uterine adenosarcoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The Corpus uteri, or body of uterus, is the part of the uterus above the isthmus, comprising about two thirds of the non-pregnant organ._A low grade malignant neoplasm characterized by the presence of a benign epithelial component (tubular and cleft-like glands) and a low grade sarcomatous component that contains varying amounts of fibrous and smooth muscle tissues. In a minority of cases, the sarcomatous component contains heterologous elements including striated muscle, cartilage, and fat. It occurs in the uterine corpus, ovary, fallopian tube, cervix, and vagina. It may recur and in a minority of cases may metastasize to distant anatomic sites._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Corpus uteri, or body of uterus, is the part of the uterus above the isthmus, comprising about two thirds of the non-pregnant organ.:A low grade malignant neoplasm characterized by the presence of a benign epithelial component (tubular and cleft-like glands) and a low grade sarcomatous component that contains varying amounts of fibrous and smooth muscle tissues. In a minority of cases, the sarcomatous component contains heterologous elements including striated muscle, cartilage, and fat. It occurs in the uterine corpus, ovary, fallopian tube, cervix, and vagina. It may recur and in a minority of cases may metastasize to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: The Corpus uteri, or body of uterus, is the part of the uterus above the isthmus, comprising about two thirds of the non-pregnant organ.

A low grade malignant neoplasm characterized by the presence of a benign epithelial component (tubular and cleft-like glands) and a low grade sarcomatous component that contains varying amounts of fibrous and smooth muscle tissues. In a minority of cases, the sarcomatous component contains heterologous elements including striated muscle, cartilage, and fat. It occurs in the uterine corpus, ovary, fallopian tube, cervix, and vagina. It may recur and in a minority of cases may metastasize to distant anatomic sites.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Uterine Adenosarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of adenosarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: No regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of adenosarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
